thread.title: IU trustees approve downtown Evansville medical school
thread.title_full: IU trustees approve downtown Evansville medical school

title: IU trustees approve downtown Evansville medical school
text:
IU trustees approve downtown Evansville medical school; state budget committee next 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 8/15/15 12:20 pm EDT - Updated: 8/15/15 12:22 pm EDT 
EVANSVILLE, Indiana â€” A planned medical school campus in downtown Evansville has passed another hurdle as officials hope to break ground in October. 
The Evansville Courier & Press reports ( http://bit.ly/1Jj5Hma ) the Indiana University board of trustees gave final approval of the plan Friday. The state budget committee will vote in October whether to release the $25.5 million in state funds for the project. 
The Indiana Legislature approved that money for the IU and University of Southern Indiana portions of the medical campus. The University of Evansville, a private institution, is contributing $6 million. City Council has approved a $57 million bond for the campus and related development. 
Mayor Lloyd Winnecke said he doesn't see any reason the state budget committee wouldn't release the funds when it meets Oct. 12. 
Information from: Evansville Courier & Press, http://www.courierpress.com
